document.title: Health Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

1E45CA3A388748A48CCC490C6030C0DA.description: Promote global environmental health and/or disease prevention projects.

62D35FCAD8CF47C79FB3A6EC3840E6B3.description:
Develop a long-term plan for oneself and/or the family to positively impact a health-related
social issue.

1D914BD0935E4DADAA6E8D11BC081781.description: Create a message about the importance of avoiding gang involvement.

981A14FC116C47DD8A284F427158EA48.description:
Apply appropriate conflict-resolution skills to prevent, manage, de-escalate, defuse,
and/or resolve conflict in a variety of situations.

F05474F8E0AE4B7085E2D48DA38BFFEB.description: Promote access to mental health resources to help oneself and others.

CCB9024B7D1D494CAB06D03BA2BC823B.description:
Create strategies to manage personal information and communicate effectively online,
and balance technology use with offline activities.

0411321360864F82A9B404D388E311EA.description:
Create strategies to manage deadlines for a school-related activity (e.g., studying for a
test, completing a project).

31509D110F1242FABBBE63D52061CCD7.description: Develop action steps to promote a safe and inclusive school environment.

01453158D70C49E2BF10034E41E4B96E.description: Demonstrate healthy decision-making strategies related to risky behaviors.

500147EFAC034DDAB3ECDDB1FD4DA192.description:
Advocate for reporting signs and symptoms and for safety practices to prevent brain
injury.

29C922DB1AA447A5870A495FE4CE6819.description:
Demonstrate adult and child cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), use of automated
external defibrillator (AED), and first aid skills for choking, bleeding, contusions,
fractures, and anaphylactic shock.

2CA594E1A8AB4735A4FD5A743E1D84A3.description:
Research consequences of drug abuse, including stealing to support a drug habit, arrest,
prosecution, and jail.

F2691DB898D7465BA066C2EB57A912B1.description: Develop a personal plan to prevent substance use.

D6021D6E4D3C43C9B73E10B64933D112.description:
Promote ways to encourage reporting peer substance use to trusted adults (e.g., parents,
teachers, coaches, doctors).

7DDD022298C34ED3886DA05D7943EA8D.description: Promote vision, hearing, and dental health.

16033E7DBCFC4F148C36B781016ED3EC.description:
Analyze data on the spread of diseases, and develop personal prevention strategies
based on information analyzed.

C07A4E0695F7446FBA6B1A234CC1F785.description:
Assess personal risk factors for diabetes, heart disease, cancer, obesity, and stroke, and
develop personal prevention strategies.

86C17B2E81734D38BDDC6DCF46D5B02A.description:
Design a wellness plan for physical activity, sleep, rest, and nutrition to meet current
health goals.

BAF33A7D1B9A4EC39DE8F8D2C8B243D8.description:
Explore careers associated with healthy food choices (e.g., dietetics, nutrition, farming,
environmental science, food production, food safety, restaurant ownership).

D9B2877D517C46BFA04B4F7193AE7A1B.description:
Create one or more S.M.A.R.T. goals for personal consumption of vitamins and
minerals and develop a plan to meet them.

8193E10973AD4464AA1B31E4A8CD9C6F.description: Promote behaviors that protect endocrine system health.

362032E3E99344D99B31A6634DBFC6BA.description: The student will demonstrate skills to advocate for personal and community health.

536EC8516B584F05B402A9B5BB62102D.description: Examine the impact of global environmental health issues on local communities.

695AAA1834E441BC812F915B8323B38D.description: Evaluate strategies for improving health-related social issues.

5047DFBD1090411D9EBFD117C8928B8C.description:
Examine how the consequences associated with gang involvement could affect oneself,
the family, and the community in the present and the future.

E149CECB03B14466965E347C130DCE04.description: Identify strategies for peaceful resolution of conflict.

6FDC554934C1425984C3FADF7260456F.description:
Identify school and community mental health resources to help and assist with mental
illnesses or challenges.

86656A1620014C26AEBAF4E96D9E7341.description: Explain limitations to effective communication online.

0633DF4C30224995BC64F050E54798F9.description: Analyze how time management might contribute to stress reduction.

55472B7FCE614FAAA172A06D9E526223.description:
Identify strategies to respond to and report potential threats to individuals or the
school.

C5F82AF3BC864C22A5B739786D96467E.description:
Analyze level of risk associated with a variety of behaviors, including weapon use and
gang involvement.

46B8217137084A948CB2BEA46AB3B13E.description:
Identify common signs/symptoms (e.g., cognitive, emotional, physical, sleep) of a
concussion.

610A059C30364A96B78DDFB22B3E85FA.description:
Evaluate the long-term consequences of injury and describe controllable and
uncontrollable risk factors.

A8B496F04F0A48DC8A9674E3DB8A6F62.description: Analyze and draw inferences about behaviors connected to addiction and mental health.

159C26831DD04E2D832C131943AB0A0B.description:
Develop a set of personal standards to resist the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other
harmful substances and behaviors.

E0C2492C3DCF45E18231B4C256E6D4B5.description:
Evaluate the effects of alcohol and other drugs on human body systems, brain function,
and behavior, and describe health benefits associated with abstaining from alcohol,
tobacco, or other drugs.

ED71F742478A40D8AEB3A14C5E229D06.description: Determine strategies to protect vision, hearing, and dental health.

C247CE3EE6554920BC1F3898B4E54CE3.description:
Understand the difference between an epidemic and a pandemic and how they impact
populations.

97A2540B41774D7E8799F4B6D4CD0013.description:
Identify behaviors that contribute to heart disease, stroke, diabetes, cancer, obesity, and
other chronic diseases and conditions.

61D2F746D9C844D0B77D158F3B2CA591.description:
Explain the physical, mental, and academic benefits of proper nutrition, sleep and rest,
physical activity, maintaining a healthy body weight, and other personal wellness
behaviors.

F6134D21FB29470A9A17D45557BE1D17.description:
Explore community resources for purchasing locally grown/sourced foods, including
the concept of farm-to-table/restaurant.

0B676AFD47004496BFA4731F4182F60B.description:
Analyze personal daily intake to determine if one is meeting daily values for vitamins
and minerals.

7E14EA763CF4498DAF81008E29ABD54C.description: Identify health risks and other factors that affect the function of the endocrine system.

B2C04BF1D25D4E3BA971DC6E10D10132.description:
The student will explain the impact of health risks and identify strategies and resources to
limit risk.

B092274BB1CE40E39E56EB3B2EFBD47D.description:
Identify health-related social issues, such as homelessness, underage drinking, and
substance abuse.

83C2992A00184C0F9669EF975D55BEE7.description:
Identify risky behaviors adolescents engage in, including weapon use and gang
involvement.

B2A4D5107FD1454386F4B856F8CC2D97.description: Identify types of gangs, gang-related behaviors, and associated consequences.

76C64FCF4B254CE7ACE34BBDADC9BCA1.description:
Identify causes of conflict with friends and family and feelings/emotions both sides
might experience.

39BE59704C654A099074A9D2EC3B2649.description:
Identify signs and symptoms of mental illnesses or challenges (e.g., anxiety,
depression, suicide, eating disorders, self-harm behaviors).

DAA5C7442714437B83D12086C4F1FAE4.description:
Describe the positive and negative effects of social media and of sharing personal
information online.

9AB991C2497E42CF9200367DB8BC6848.description: Identify effective time-management and organizational skills.

8F2B8ECF8AE94DAB98EA11BD78D71103.description:
Describe actions, behaviors, and signs that may indicate potential threats to individuals
or the school.

C5134A4F468F43BA8B9B4D59400FAF4F.description:
Define traumatic and non-traumatic brain injury and identify examples of each,
including concussion.

E52D6BCCD0C04040AAE73CAA5747FD80.description:
Identify behaviors that contribute to injuries and that may result in irreversible
consequences.

9846E8E86F7F4415B51ECBC76A0CD80C.description:
Explain facts about opioids and why teens are more vulnerable to heroin and
prescription opioids.

62293BBA14ED4B3DAA1E5FB9151917AF.description: Analyze the consequences of binge drinking.

8FCA1B031E7343F0B883DF16452362D7.description: Explain how alcohol and other drugs increase the risk of injury.

2CDA2629AC8E41CF9A269E40DFC97A8C.description:
Describe the importance of health habits that promote vision, hearing, and dental
health.

19D6DB7FF1D14D54AF612E63D22CDE44.description:
Define herd immunity and explain how immunizations can prevent the spread of
diseases.

CC4B2A5F4CAE44DD86D33B50AC76CDC3.description:
Identify common types of chronic disease including diabetes, heart disease, cancer,
obesity, and stroke.

2FA016408D7940A4B45F4DBCFEFFE302.description:
Describe the prevalence, causes, and long-term consequences of unhealthy eating, sleep
deprivation, extended screen time, and sedentary lifestyle.

37D8AB6B168F4C57942BC69B2471A502.description: Explain organic, fresh, farm-raised, “lite,” low-fat, and fat-free foods.

7A820AC8619D4F9D8269535154621006.description:
Explain the differences between and fat-soluble and water-soluble vitamins, food and
non-food sources of vitamins, the role of vitamin and mineral supplements, and
associated dietary reference intakes (DRIs) to maintain health.

FD5018E0B2BF4916923CBE8EC20DD1FB.description: Identify and describe the major structures and functions of the endocrine system.

0D9A2BC4454148E2824E29D930DED0B8.description:
The student will apply health knowledge and skills to achieve and maintain long-term
health and wellness.
